import Mathlib

open Set

/-- The set of condensation points of E: those x such that every open ball around x
    meets E in an uncountable set (we express uncountable as Â¬Countable). -/
def condensation_points (n : â„•) (E : Set (EuclideanSpace â„ (Fin n))) : Set (EuclideanSpace â„ (Fin n)) :=
  { x | âˆ€ r : â„, 0 < r â†’ Â¬(Countable (Metric.ball x r âˆ© E)) }

/-- Rudin exercise: if E âŠ† â„^n is uncountable, then the set P of condensation points of E is perfect. -/
theorem rudin_exercise_2_27a (n : â„•) {E : Set (EuclideanSpace â„ (Fin n))} (hE : Â¬Countable E) :
  Perfect (condensation_points n E) := by sorry

import Mathlib

open Set

/-- The set of condensation points of E: those x such that every open ball around x
    meets E in an uncountable set (we express uncountable as Â¬Countable). -/
def condensation_points (n : â„•) (E : Set (EuclideanSpace â„ (Fin n))) : Set (EuclideanSpace â„ (Fin n)) :=
  { x : EuclideanSpace â„ (Fin n) | âˆ€ r : â„, 0 < r â†’ Â¬ (Set.Countable ((Metric.ball x r) âˆ© E)) }

/-- Rudin exercise: if E âŠ† â„^n is uncountable, then the set P of condensation points of E is perfect. -/
theorem rudin_exercise_2_27a (n : â„•) {E : Set (EuclideanSpace â„ (Fin n))} (hE : Â¬ Set.Countable E) :
  Perfect (condensation_points n E) := by sorry
